reviews.author: Phil the Lego Nerd
reviews.content: Lego nerd and college student here. I didn’t get paid to write a review. This set is a bit underwhelming, especially compared to some of the other Lego Harry Potter sets released thus far. I would only recommend it if you’ve boughten all the other Harry Potter sets and need it to complete the collection. When I gave this set to my 9 year old cousin, it took him only 15 minutes to build, and was not challenging at all. The figures are not unique (both versions of Harry and Ron appear in the Hogwarts Express set.) They do have double sided heads though (as seen in the pictures.) Aragog the spider is sleek, and stands well, but he does not have many play features, other than his pincers and his abdomen, which moves up and down. The moving abdomen, quite frankly isn’t even really a play feature, even if the instructions seem to suggest  so. Admittedly, though, Aragog is quite adorable and looks great on display. The small spiders are made out of hard plastic which is nice. The tree is your standard Lego tree, with nothing special to note, other than a flick-fire stud shooter which fires a web piece shown in one of the photos. The set also includes some extra parts as shown in my photos. My set came in a smashed box which seems to be a theme with some of the other reviews here (which is why I did not photograph the box this time.) Overall, while it’s not a terrible set, I’d pass on this one unless you absolutely need it.
reviews.product: LEGO Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets Aragog's Lair 75950 Building Kit (157 Pieces)
reviews.title: Cute spider, but get this set only once you’ve gotten all the others

reviews.author: AK Family
reviews.content: Part of large spider (brown part on page 36 of building guide, step 19) is missing; we could construct it without the part but the spider shape isn't great. For the name brand item, I expected all the parts to be included. There was a similar-shaped brown piece that was not used in the build, but it is too small to become part of the abdomen; perhaps it was accidentally included? We were excited to get the kit but disappointed that it is incomplete. We're using this to decorate the house for Halloween otherwise I would have returned the kit and requested a replacement. I did not find a place to contact Amazon about the missing part, and I doubt a replacement would arrive before Halloween.
reviews.product: LEGO Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets Aragog's Lair 75950 Building Kit (157 Pieces)
reviews.title: missing part

reviews.author: The LEGO Guy
reviews.content: If you're looking for a small LEGO gift for that Harry Potter fan out there, then this set is perfect. This LEGO set comes with Harry Potter and Ron Weasley, as well as, a large version of Aragog (which looks awesome by the way). The set also comes with 5 smaller spiders (two black and three brown). The final completed lair scene looks nice and features a decent amount of playability considering the smaller size of this set. Both Harry and Ron feature dual faces. As you can see in my images, one version of their face is 'all is well' while the other version is absolutely scared and frightened. I really enjoy when LEGO offers alternate faces because you can then do a lot more in regard to scene creation and role playing. The small torch that Harry is carrying is nice and the lit lantern that Ron has is definitely impressive. For a set this small, there is quite a lot of detail and creative approach to the LEGO design and building. There's a lot of movement and playability with Aragog as you can articulate the legs as well as the eyes and back portion of the spider. I'm also a big fan of all the brown LEGO pieces and different shades of brown offered in this set. Overall, this set is on the smaller side, but it does pack a decent size punch. I recommend this set for both Harry Potter fans and even those who aren't, as there's much offered in this set. Thank you for reading. Hopefully you found my review helpful. If so, please let me know below. Happy bricking!

reviews.title: Great Harry Potter starter set

reviews.author: SW
reviews.content: This small, newly released Harry Potter theme set is a quick build, but extremely atmospheric, with lots of little details in the tree and the spider itself is pretty cool. The Harry and Ron mini-figures are also unique and fun additions, and my kids liked this a lot more than most sets of its size. As a mom, can't help but notice that this would make a great Halloween present, and is actually more spookily festive, and less expensive, than many of the holiday-specific offerings from Lego. Really fun little set, for Harry Potter fans or just as a non-edible Halloween trick-or-treat.
reviews.product: LEGO Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets Aragog's Lair 75950 Building Kit (157 Pieces)
reviews.title: Great Set for Halloween

reviews.author: Steven G.
reviews.content: When I got this box, I hid it somewhere in the hotel room where we were staying and told my daughter of a scary animal in the room we had to find. After a few riddles she found it, and immediately build it. The spider is awesome, all legs move, the big and small fangs move and even the back tail moves up and down. Great little unit and she even liked mixing it with storm troopers who all got eaten!! The build for such a small set is fairly easy, and a smart 5 year old can definitely do this.
reviews.product: LEGO Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets Aragog's Lair 75950 Building Kit (157 Pieces)
reviews.title: Scary spider!!

reviews.author: Hannah L. Butcher
reviews.content: I absolutely love this set. Aragog is amazingly cool. all but one set of his legs are slightly adjustable (they move slightly to the left & right). The instructions are great and the shooting thing is okay. Love the way Aragog looks. This may be my favorite Lego piece.
reviews.product: LEGO Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets Aragog's Lair 75950 Building Kit (157 Pieces)
reviews.title: Love Aragog!!!

reviews.author: LawyerMom
reviews.content: Great small sized lego kit for Harry Potter fans.  The instructions are clear and incredibly easy to follow.  My 6 and 12 year old love this set. I enjoy that they can do it on their own, learn to follow written (or drawn) instructions, and practice some fine motor skills (since they have some delays in that area).  My kids just completed watching the Harry Potter movie that had the giant spider in it, so now they love being able to act it out with the Lego character.
reviews.product: LEGO Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets Aragog's Lair 75950 Building Kit (157 Pieces)
reviews.title: Quality

reviews.author: Kid Kyoto
reviews.content: Our kids got this for Christmas and I was a bit worried they'd be scared by it (the younger is just 6) but no they embraced it and built it with a little help from Daddy. As others pointed out Aragog is a well-made figure with moving legs, head and rear, the little spiders will see a lot of use in their castles, and Harry and Ron's double sided heads (with a normal face and a scared face) were a big hit. The 'shooting' web is a bit pointless (you flick it with a finger, may as well throw a brick in that case) but the tree is properly creepy with webs and moss growing on it. Glad we got it!
reviews.product: LEGO Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets Aragog's Lair 75950 Building Kit (157 Pieces)
reviews.title: Fine kit even for 6 year olds

reviews.author: Amazon Customer
reviews.content: I have mixed feelings on this set. It's relatively inexpensive, the minifigures are well made, the new Aragog has some nice elements and it's good to get a number of the smaller spiders. That being said, it's a little too basic and feels a bit limited in play value as a stand alone set compared to the creepy Forrest the scene is based on. The build is all about the spiders and Aragog is good but the eyes look a little comical to me. The lair itself is just a small tree that feels overly "bright". Would have been nice to see it have a darker tone to it to help with the overall feeling of the set. Pros: -Aragog is big and well built -Harry and Ron look good in a change of pace from the Hogwarts gear -Get a lot of spiders Cons: -Build is very small and overly basic
reviews.product: LEGO Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets Aragog's Lair 75950 Building Kit (157 Pieces)
reviews.title: Simple set with nice spiders

reviews.author: Scott William Foley
reviews.content: My daughter loves both Harry Potter and Legos, so when we saw this on Amazon Vine, we instantly grabbed it.  She's already picked up quite a few of the new Harry Potter Lego sets, and this is a great addition.  She loved putting it together.  It wasn't the most challenging, she said, but it certainly kept her entertained.  She thinks the big spider is sufficiently creepy, and also appreciates all of the little spiders that came with it.  She's also very happy with the Harry and Ron that came in the set, too.  It fits very nicely when set near the new Hogwarts Castle.  If you have a Harry Potter Lego fan in the house, you can't go wrong with this set.
reviews.product: LEGO Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets Aragog's Lair 75950 Building Kit (157 Pieces)
reviews.title: Great Addition To the New Sets

reviews.author: Book Princess
reviews.content: So, my boyfriend & I are doing this thing where we put together Lego sets, but make it a drinking game. If you drop a piece or mess up the 'snap,' you have to take a drink. This set was a fun first project as I messed up very little, and he ended up drinking most of my drink. I am sure we will play again with another set. Before you act all disgusted, Yes, I have an 8 year old son. Yes. I am perfectly capable, happy & proud to put legos together with him completely sober, so put your judgy pants away. Legos are fun for all ages in all sorts of ways. My review of this set is, BUY IT! Worth every penny.
reviews.product: LEGO Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets Aragog's Lair 75950 Building Kit (157 Pieces)
reviews.title: FUN FOR ALL AGES!

reviews.author: Two kids mom
reviews.content: This set is worth it just for the minifigs at a sub sixteen price.  I love that you can rotate the faces from normal to scared. Takes about fifteen minutes for a teenager to build.  The put together set is sturdy enough for actual play by elementary school kids. The shooting part is mildly amusing, but the real star of the show is Aragog, with articulated legs.
reviews.product: LEGO Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets Aragog's Lair 75950 Building Kit (157 Pieces)
